alert.note: Alert for Coastal Bay; Coastal Gulf; South Walton (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Surf Warning issued January 10 at 3:37AM EST until January 10 at 11:00AM EST by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...HIGH SURF WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM EST /10 AM CST/ THIS MORNING... ...HIGH RIP CURRENT RISK REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH SATURDAY EVENING... * WHAT...For the High Rip Current Risk, dangerous rip currents. For the High Surf Warning, dangerously large breaking waves of up to 10 feet expected in the surf zone. * WHERE...Walton, Bay, and Gulf County Beaches. * WHEN...For the High Surf Warning, until 11 AM EST /10 AM CST/ Wednesday. For the High Rip Current Risk, through Saturday evening. * IMPACTS...Breaking waves can sweep people off jetties and docks, and into dangerous seas. Life- threatening swimming conditions and significant beach erosion can be expected. Rip currents can sweep even the best swimmers away from shore into deeper water.
info.instruction: Everyone should remain out of the water due to life-threatening surf conditions. Stay off of jetties, piers, and other waterside infrastructure. Swim near a lifeguard. If caught in a rip current, relax and float. Don`t swim against the current. If able, swim in a direction following the shoreline. If unable to escape, face the shore and call or wave for help.

area.areaDesc: Coastal Bay; Coastal Gulf; South Walton
